description: First floor rear extension incorporating roof terraces; creation of additional residential flat (Use Class C3) at 12 Norwood Road (Joint Application)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers and supporting document(s): 3198/01/JG (Existing Ground Floor Plan); 3198/02/JG (Existing First Floor Plan); 3198/03/JG (Existing Second Floor Plan); 3198/04/JG (Existing Front and Rear Elevations); 3198/05/JG (Existing Side Elevations); 3198/06/JG (Existing Side Elevations); 3198/07/JG (Existing Side Elevations); 3198/07B/JG (Proposed Ground Floor Plan); 3198/08/JG (Proposed First Floor Plan), received 29/04/2024; 3198/08B/JG (Proposed Roof Plan); 3198/09/JG (Proposed Front and Rear Elevation); 3198/10/JG (Proposed Side Elevations); 3198/11/JG (Proposed Side Elevations); 3198/12/JG (Proposed Side Elevations); 3198/14/JG (Proposed Site Plan); Fire Strategy Report by Absolute Fire Protection Ltd; Ground Floor Fire Alarm and Detection System; First Floor Fire Alarm and Detection System; Second Floor Fire Alarm and Detection System; Ground Floor Emergency Lights; First Floor Emergency Lights; Second Floor Emergency Lights.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| Prior to use of the first floor rear roof terraces hereby approved, the privacy screening identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be installed. The privacy screen shall be retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 19).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays, in accordance with internal noise limits specified in BS8233:2014 and including the aircraft noise data in Section 6, SPG10 (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour (57dB). Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, eg. bedrooms adjoining/above/below kitchen/ living/ dining/ bathroom of separate dwelling and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedrooms adjoining the communal staircase. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The cycle and refuse storage identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate cycle and refuse storage facilities for future occupiers in accordance with Policies T5 and SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).
